SEI.Class Name: Intro to Ceramics - High Fire Techniques

summary_comment: Professor Robbins is highly regarded for his engaging and enjoyable teaching style, offering ample opportunities for students to submit late work and receive extended deadlines for projects. While there were delays in providing feedback and grades, students appreciate the supportive learning environment he creates.
summary_comment_short: Professor Robbins is an excellent instructor who provides ample opportunities for students to submit late work and receive extensions on projects. The class is described as both fun and engaging.

Ratings.comment: Really great teacher. didn't get feedback/ grades until the last few weeks but given a lot of opportunity to turn in late work/ get extra time on projects. really fun and engaging class.

summary_comment: Professor Wnuk is widely regarded as one of the top instructors in her field, known for her thoughtful approach to teaching, including detailed assignments, constructive feedback, and a supportive class environment that fosters both artistic growth and confidence. Her genuine care for her students and ability to inspire creativity and critical thinking make her classes highly recommended for both art and non-art majors alike.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wnuk is widely recognized as one of the top instructors in her field, known for her thoughtful approach to teaching, including detailed assignments, constructive feedback, and a supportive class environment that fosters both artistic growth and confidence. Her genuine care for students, combined with inspiring and unique assignments, creates a dynamic and encouraging learning experience.

Ratings.comment: YES YES YES YES. Chantal is known among students and faculties to be one of the best instructors in P&D. Everything is so thoughtful, from assignments to feedbacks to the arrangement of works for the open house show at the end of the term. She cares and she knows how to. Oh and her music playlist is delightful and refreshing

Chantal cares about her students. I mean they all do, but she really does. She gives great lectures, assignments, constructive insights. She is a genuine listener and observer, compassionate and considerate. I dunno, there's so many great things about her. I would recommend her to anyone, art or non-art folks.

Chantal is so lovely and does such a great job of making sure everyone feels confident and secure in their art while simultaneously pushing you to be better and improve. I could see tangible growth in not only my drawing abilities, but also my confidence throughout the semester. This was one of my favorite classes and I highly recommend.

Please take a class with her if you can! Chantal is such an inspiration. My drawing class was unlike any Ive taken before, our assignments were so unique and actually made us get creative and experiment and change the ways we think about art. The class environment was so encouraging and I feel so accomplished after just one semester. Shes a gem!

summary_comment: Professor Simmons is widely regarded as a highly knowledgeable artist but is severely criticized for his poor communication skills and teaching methods. Students find his lectures confusing, his feedback unconstructive, and his interactions with them dismissive and frustrating. Overall, his teaching approach is seen as detrimental to the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Simmons is widely regarded as a poor communicator who contradicts himself frequently and fails to provide constructive feedback, making his classes challenging and frustrating for students. Despite his deep understanding of art, his inability to effectively convey information or engage students hinders their learning experience.

Ratings.comment: All these years later after graduating, I still remember him as the single worst teacher I have ever had in my 40 years of existence. No surname was necessary in the Art department; if you referenced the name Paul with enough stank, everyone knew who exactly it was. He was remarkably terrible at communication and contradicted himself constantly.

Doesn't really listen to you AT ALL and would rather hear himself talk! Doesn't like it when students want to have a little bit more fun with his projects as they tend to be fairly bland. While he knows a lot about art and its medium, he'll usually only skim over his slides and hopes you understood everything.  Doesn't give constructive critique.

Paul's communication skills were seriously lacking. I believe he thought his assignments were deep and thought provoking, but they were the insane ramblings of an egoist. I think the only person that knew what Paul was talking about was Paul. Even that is debatable. Stay away. If you take his class, it will only be a void in your artistic career.

His communication skills are poor; he talks AT us and not TO us. His understanding of Art in general is superb and he seems very talented, but he doesn't know how to give constructive criticism. I would love to be friends with him outside of an academic environment,but he just doesn't know how to communicate with us as students. he's adorable too.

He has poor communication skills; he talks at us. his level of artistic understanding is high, but his understanding of helping others is lacking. I would love to be friends with him outside an academic environment, but as an instructor he's so-so.

Very uninspiring. Though I'm doing well in the class, he frustrates me to no end. The way he treats some of my classmates is deplorable. I love Art and painting in particular, but I'm now considering other options because of him. Professors in other areas in the Arts inspire me more and are far more respectful.

Trying to be objective as possible: he SHOULDN'T be a teacher. He has horrible communication skills in that he tells you one thing, and when you follow his advice, he is confused why you did. I have never been treated so poorly by even another person. He went out of his way not to give constructive critiques-but to cut us down and make us feel bad

summary_comment: Professor Peters is known for being a knowledgeable and caring instructor who emphasizes effort and participation over project quality. Despite occasional organizational issues and unstructured class sessions, students appreciate his enthusiasm and willingness to help with accommodations. However, some find the class unorganized and confusing, with vague explanations and strict grading, leading to frustration among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Peters is known for being a knowledgeable and caring instructor who values effort over perfection, though his classes are often described as unorganized and sometimes confusing. Despite these organizational issues, students appreciate his enthusiasm and find him easy to work with, though some find the grading to be overly strict for an introductory course.

Ratings.comment: Aaron is a great person and instructor and I would urge you to ignore some of the other responses here. I can understand that the class can seem fast paced, but it really just takes applying yourself to the projects and asking questions. Aaron is a knowledgable, funny, and caring person and a great artist!

He can be pretty unorganized, but his enthusiasm makes up for it. We did three projects which were focused on teaching us new artmaking skills. There were a few open note quizzes. He grades based on effort and participation, not the "quality" of your project, which is nice. He's very nice and easy to work with if you need any accommodations.
Class could be better organized, but overall a nice individual
He's a good person, but he's unorganized and the class wasn't sure what was going on a lot of the time.

Mr. Peters is a nice guy, he's a little awkward though. The Zoom meetings could have been cut down, they were two hours long and if you weren't listening you wouldn't miss anything. Personally the "project check-ups" irritated me, but not turning in the "checkpoint" homework had very little effect on my grade; he is a lax grader!

Hard grader for an introductory course. Explanations are very vague and class is super unorganized. Dont know what Im supposed to be doing more than half of the time. Over explains simple things. You have to spend your own money on unnecessary things. Hours spent on homework and projects outside of class. Just dont take it. Dont.

I have never taken a art class so unorganized. Professor lacks communication about projects and neglects to give demonstrations or clear explanations. Takes forever to put in grades and very harsh grader despite the fact its an intro to drawing class.

summary_comment: Professor Horning is highly regarded for her kindness, enthusiasm, and dedication to student growth, often compared to a real-life Ms. Frizzle. While her lectures can sometimes run long, students appreciate her clear explanations, helpful feedback, and availability. Despite occasional clarity issues with the syllabus and instructions, her approachable nature and willingness to assist make her a popular choice among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Horning is highly regarded for her kindness, enthusiasm, and dedication to student growth, though her lectures can sometimes be lengthy. Despite some confusion with the syllabus and instructions, students appreciate her supportive feedback and willingness to help.

Ratings.comment: Jessie is a wonderful professor! Kind, funny, enthusiastic, and understanding!
Syllabus is unclear and changed rapidly

Super nice! Honestly like a irl Ms Frizzle. Lectures can run long and could be 1/4 of the length and still get the point across, but theyre usually recorded so you can watch outside of class. She gives realy helpful feedback and makes sure to check in with every student. Her main goal is that you show growth so as long as you do the work youre ok

Jessie is so sweet! She's funny and makes class fun. Sometimes lectures/instructions were a little hard to follow or dragged on, but she's very knowledgeable and always willing to help. Definitely would take her class again.

No tests, didn't have to show up during final. Gives you at least a C if you finish the drawing. Easy class, just long hours. A nice lady, can be air-headed at times. Brings food to class occasionally. She shows power points of drawing skills (ex. shading styles) but doesn't really explain/show how to do it personally unless you ask for help.

summary_comment: Professor Ng is an outstanding instructor known for his professionalism and passion in teaching art. Students find his classes both informative and engaging, leading to significant learning outcomes. He offers a manageable workload with primarily drawing assignments and one paper, making it possible to achieve good grades easily.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ng is an excellent instructor known for his professionalism and passion in teaching art. Students find his classes engaging and recommend them for their comprehensive learning experience and potential for earning an "A" with minimal effort.

Ratings.comment: Excellent instructor, professional and passionate in art. Learnt a lot from this class. Easy A. Drawing al lot and one paper. Recommend take this class with him.

summary_comment: No comments available
summary_comment_short: No comments available

summary_comment: Professor Heurtin teaches ART 2555 with a focus on making introductory photography engaging through detailed lectures and occasional workshops. She is responsive to student inquiries and provides supplementary materials like videos. However, she is noted for being a tough grader and places a strong emphasis on participation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Heurtin is known for her engaging and fun approach to teaching introductory photography, making the subject accessible for beginners. She is responsive and provides detailed resources, but is noted for being a tough grader, emphasizing participation and active engagement in the class.

Ratings.comment: I took ART 2555 with professor Heurtin and absolutely loved it! She made intro to photography fun and I feel like she was fair with grades and such. She was responsive to emails and had videos posted for lecture which helps describe what was necessary in detail. Would recommend this class and professor.
Tough Grader

This class is fun and great for those new to photography. Geren teaches this class with mostly lectures and a few workshop days. There are a few readings and we rarely used the textbook (which she provided). She cares very deeply about participation. Many of our classes were cancelled or moved to zoom. There are no tests except for the midterm.

summary_comment: Professor Brinkman is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and artistic talent, making his classes both informative and enjoyable. Students appreciate his kindness, genuineness, and ability to engage them in the subject matter. However, some find his lectures lengthy and feel he can come across as entitled.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brinkman is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and artistic talent, making him an invaluable resource for students. His classes are praised for being engaging and well-structured, though some note that he tends to extend lectures longer than advertised.

Ratings.comment: Dustin is a certified gem. If you can take any class with him, do it. It is hard to find people who are good at art and teaching, but he is great at both. You will get a good grade if you listen to directions, show up & try. He is kind, genuine, smart, and goofy. Plus he makes awesome art so learning from him is a great privilege. 10/10 recommend
Definitely loves to hear himself talk so be prepared to listen to a lot of speeches and when he says that's all he has for the day, don't believe it. Nice enough guy, just really entitled.

summary_comment: Professor Widomski is widely regarded as highly unprofessional and disrespectful, with many students describing her as passive-aggressive and overly critical. Her grading is reportedly harsh, with little room for leniency, and she often leaves students feeling undermined and ignored, especially when seeking clarification or assistance. Students warn strongly against taking her class, citing significant challenges and a generally negative experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Widomski is widely regarded as highly unprofessional and disrespectful, with students describing her as passive-aggressive and overly critical, often leading to low grades for minor reasons. The class is reportedly very demanding and time-consuming, with unclear directions and a focus on writing that may not align well with the expectations of an art class.

Ratings.comment: If you are thinking about taking this class... do not do it.. warning lies here. I took this class as an online GE course, i thought, this should be an easy A .  I never once argued with and a teacher, but she was my first. She is SOOOO disrespectful, extremely passive agressive , but tries to come off as nice to her students, it is all a facade.
I think Rachel is super nice, the only comment I have is that sometimes her directions are not very clear. Overall, this art class I would recommend to other students.

I took 2D art, and nearly all we did was tracings. she did no lectures or interaction with the class at all and expected us to read the textbook and spend literally so much time outside of class doing just busywork. I spent at least 150 hours and several all-nighters, and I got a D+. It's so ridiculously easy to fall behind in the project deadlines

Super nice. She acknowledges that this is a beginner class, so everyone is in different places (grades based one effort). Sometimes the work was a little time-consuming, but it was a nice break from my other classes. If you need help with anything in the class, then just ask her and she will help you.

This is supposed to be an art GE course, but her grading is literally harsher than calculus/physics. You'll get 0's for little to no reason. I got a 0 on an assignment because my body physically casted a shadow on the drawing. It's like a joke.

Immediate drop after day 1. Heed the warnings here, I read them and thought she couldn't be that bad. She was. I've never met another GE teacher that sits on such a high horse and expects that much. Just take art education instead, it's easier and more fun.

Most unprofessional and disrespectful professor I have had. She leaves hurtful and non-constructive comments, so much so our entire class had to email the head chair to talk with her. Her rude attitude never waivers and makes you feel ignorant for asking questions. She gives zeros after not clarifying what she wants but requires specificities.

Said-You shouldve done it right the first time I dont believe in extra credit. Her assignments seem simple but her grading is extremely complex. If youre not extremely persistent and constantly in contact w her you wont pass. This class functions heavily on writing capabilities even though its an art class. Use writing center!

Rachel is one of the worst professors I've had. Gives little direction yet expects you to know how to do things. Extremely passive aggressive in text and lectures. Doesn't give clear directions when asking how to do assignment, points to assignment guidelines on canvas, yet those are incomplete as well.

Personally, I wouldnt take this class if you didnt have too. It being online AU20 was very hard for me to pick up the different methods. I feel like when she was giving feedback she did not take that into account that maybe the reason why some of her students werent picking up the method all the way was because we werent in a classroom setting.

Super hard to reach outside of class. Late responses for emails, tough grader, and take forever to grade an assignment. I was really expected contemporary art course, now I'm disappointed by this professor.

Terrible professor. She takes forever to grade assignments and provides no feedback on how to improve. Not easily accessible outside of class as this was a direct quote from her, sorry, my schedule is more important than yours. For final grades, she said we cant email about them until NEXT TERM. I will never take any of her classes again.

Rachel means well, I'm sure. But, she doesn't offer any feedback on the assignments you so and she offers little to no chance to get your grades up and doesn't "believe in" extra credit. So, bomb one assignment and you're done for. She takes herself way too seriously for a GE art lecture, and I'm an ART major.

The course is insane. Rachel means well, but tends to take these courses to serious. Not asking for a handout, but its art. No disrespect to any students or professors who are in that department, Lets just be real. Its art. Will never take her courses again.

She kind of takes a while to grade. She does try to give good feedback that will help but only after youve done the drawing. She doesnt really teach you, but just gives a small explanation and makes you figure it out yourself. I mean its doable but kinda confusing the way the class is laid out
Very helpful with developing art skills in photoshop, open to ideas from her students. Sometimes unclear, but literally everything is in the syllabus.

Rachel means well and she is fairly understanding and helpful. However, the coursework is overbearing: she verbally expresses that students spend 8-10 hours outside of class per week working on projects and assignments, in addition to the 6 hours in class, attendance is mandatory and tardiness is penalized. The class consists of 5 lengthy projects

summary_comment: Professor Fletcher is widely regarded as an exceptional teacher known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, willingness to help students, and genuine care for their learning. Students appreciate his approachability and deep knowledge of photography, which they find beneficial beyond the course material. While some note a slight increase in grading standards, most agree he is fair and supportive to those who put in effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fletcher is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for being approachable, knowledgeable, and supportive. Students consistently praise his ability to explain complex concepts clearly, provide constructive feedback, and genuinely care about their learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Grant is the most incredible teacher I have ever had! He is easy to understand and interesting to listen to. He is always willing to help you out. He is so funny and tells the best stories. He also really cares about his students. He is down to earth and very relaxed. I learned so much in his classes and he is my favorite teacher I've ever had.

I had Grant for Large Format (FOTO 2500 @ CSCC).  I've heard he is tougher to his online classes but I just dont see how this guy can be tough or mean or hard to anyone.  In class, he is there for every student.  I learned a lot more about photo than just what this course covered. He is good at finding what you want to do and works from there.
He's very nice and very helpful.

I've had Grant twice so far (CSCC), and I go out of my way to try and get in his class. He is fair as long as you put in an effort, but not the teacher you want if you just want to coast through.  He is the only teacher I've had that is willing to critique not just the work for his class, but for other classes as well. All-around a great teacher.

I feel like administration told him to grade harder so I feel he is a bit more critical of grades compared to previous years, but he is still very reasonable. He is really approachable and is very knowable about photography so he has lots of ideas to help you with your projects. He gives you all the information you need for the lecture exams.

He was great! Returned all of our grades and gave helpful feedback. Did a good job explaining the material and gave excellent exam reviews! He graded very fairly and wasn't overly demanding. His looks made paying attention very easy too ;-) He's really laid back and easy to get along with. I would highly recommend him for any photo class!
He does a very good job explaining the assignments and providing assistance if needed.

whew those last two must have made some very bad grades... can you say libelous?  He's great really, he returned all of our grades... and I didnt see any gender favoritism, but there were more girls than boys in the class so you could spin that angle if you were so inclined (or pissed off)  I thought he was a good T.A.

This teacher was quite annoying at times.  We never got our grades back on our projects and never knew what to do to improve.  He did give us a great review for the midterm and final which really helped my grade.  Overall, it was a boring class but wasnt hard to do good in.

I was in that same class and Grant isn't arrogant or cocky, he fought for the class the very first day of film processing, they wanted to shut off the water while we were still developing.  He is humble and considerate and he is not there to make friends.

Arrogant and cocky, but quite knowledgeable about the field of photo. Not a difficult grader, but the class does demand a lot of time and effort.  Well worth it though. Although he was not my favorite prof, I did learn a lot.

He's a great teacher with a lot of passion for the art. He has a great love for the technical side and the artistic elements of photography with made him very enjoyable to have and learn from. He's not bad to look at either ; )

Grant is thorough, energetic, enthusiastic, and loves every single teeny tiny thing about photography.  Instead of lording his technical know-how over everyone, he is extremely helpful and understanding.  Basically, he just wants to share the love.  It was a demanding class, but a very rewarding experience.

Came off as a dick the first day, then became one of the coolest dude ever. Fun, informative class, did a helluvalot better job teaching than the lecturer. Hammer the technical aspects into you. Would take this guy again for black and white film photography. But i dont know if he'll even teach it.

Grant came off the first day as a dick, which successfully scared off half the class. The next day he apologized for coming off so harsh. He's a really nice guy that really wants to help. He’ll push you to grow. I think after the first day he actually commend some students more than they need to be. A.k.a. he won't tell you that you suck. I got an

summary_comment: Professor Kelly is effective in teaching his subject matter but can be unclear about project details and easily distracted by student inquiries. Students must proactively seek assistance and are advised to expect significant weekend commitments for the course. Despite these challenges, consistent effort leads to high grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kelly is effective in teaching his subject matter but can be unclear about project details and easily distracted by student inquiries. Students must be persistent for support and should anticipate significant time investment, particularly on weekends, to succeed in the course.

Ratings.comment: Ryan is a really nice guy and is good at teaching his trade. However, he can sometimes be unclear about his projects and gets very side tracked by students. If you need help, you have to constantly bug him until he helps you. Since it's a lab class, expect to spend your weekends completing projects. If you work hard, you'll get an A.

summary_comment: Professor Whisman offers a streamlined course structure with minimal homework, focusing primarily on in-class activities. She provides only one project and presentation per semester, which students find manageable. Known for her laid-back and lenient approach, she is highly regarded for making the course accessible and easy to pass, earning her a reputation for giving out easy As.
summary_comment_short: Professor Whisman offers a streamlined course structure with minimal homework, focusing primarily on in-class activities. She is known for her leniency and ease, making it relatively straightforward to achieve good grades, including an "easy A," in her Drawing 2100 course.

Ratings.comment: Only a few homework assignments outside of class.  Everything is done in class, never have to finish drawing assignments outside of class.  One project and presentation at end of semester (not too hard).  Professor is really chill and lenient.  Take drawing 2100 with her if you want and easy A

summary_comment: Professor Buss is an experienced and dedicated ceramic artist who challenges her students to excel, pushing them to work extensively outside of class. She fosters a deep appreciation for ceramics and treats her students as fellow artists and friends, encouraging a passionate approach to learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Buss is an exceptional ceramic instructor who brings extensive experience and passion to her role, challenging students to excel through dedicated practice and a deep appreciation for the craft. Her commitment to fostering a collaborative and inspiring learning environment encourages students to push their limits and develop as artists.

Ratings.comment: She is a ceramic grad student but has the Ceramic Wisdom of an experienced professor. She pushes those who want to succeed to the limit. Be prepared to work a lot outside of class and to get excited about ceramics! The more you want to learn, the more Elaine will treat you as a fellow artist and friend, not just a student. She is amazing!

summary_comment: Professor Meares is highly regarded for his rigorous and demanding approach to teaching, emphasizing the importance of consistent attendance and thorough preparation. Students consistently advise that completing the sketchbook assignments is crucial for success in the course. His overall teaching quality is excellent, fostering a deep understanding of the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Meares is highly regarded for his rigorous and demanding approach to teaching, emphasizing consistent attendance and thorough preparation. He requires students to maintain a sketchbook and stresses its importance for the course, while also stressing that no classes can be missed under any circumstances.

Ratings.comment: DO YOUR SKETCH BOOK! Whatever you do do not miss class for any reason!

summary_comment: Professor Daw is highly regarded for his teaching quality, described as extremely helpful and understanding of students' visions. However, his classes are challenging, with strict standards that lead to a rigorous grading process. While some find him attractive, the overall experience is demanding and not for the faint-hearted.
summary_comment_short: Professor Daw is highly regarded for his teaching quality, described as extremely helpful and meticulous in his grading. Students appreciate his dedication to ensuring high standards in their work, although they note the class is demanding and quite expensive.

Ratings.comment: real awesome.
No Comments

Micah was a very nice and easy going professor. He didn't accept laziness and was very helpful if you needed it. This class is VERY expensive however, in fact I probably spent close to $500 on supplies alone. Wants you to have gouache paint, which is never clearly instructed on how to use it, so you will probably go though many tubes like our class

Micah is extremely helpful and always seems to understand your vision for your work. It is definitely not an easy A and he grades very picky because he sees no excuse for uneven mounting or excessive rubber cement. Attendance is manditory as is with all the foundation studies but he is so gorgeous in his tight jeans it makes it hard not to go ;)

summary_comment: Professor Shineman is highly regarded for her engaging and inspiring teaching style, which fosters free thinking and provides valuable, practical knowledge. Her classes, such as 350 and 208, are noted for their enjoyable atmosphere and minimal homework, while also offering extensive advice from her professional experience in the art industry.
summary_comment_short: Professor Shineman is highly regarded for her engaging and inspirational teaching style, which fosters free thinking and provides valuable, practical knowledge. Her classes are known for their enjoyable atmosphere, with minimal homework and a focus on in-class assignments.

Ratings.comment: I recommend any, and ALL classes she is teaching. the assignments were fun and I learned wayy more useful-knowledge.  in the 2 classes of her's (350 & 208)than i have in most of my classes. Very inspiring person; encourages "free thought". Also, she has "made-it", as an artist, in the big business world, so she has endless advice 4 starving artists

Sky was really laid back and it was always an enjoyable class. the assignments were always able to be done in class so little to no homework. Sky doesn't claim to be a photoshop whiz, but she is pretty helpful.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Sanders is highly regarded for her engaging teaching style, particularly in making hand-building ceramics enjoyable even for those initially uninterested in the subject. Her charismatic presence and attractiveness make classes difficult to focus on due to students' strong interest in her personally.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sanders is highly regarded for her engaging teaching style, making even subjects like hand-building ceramics enjoyable. Her charismatic presence and enthusiasm in the classroom are notable, though some students find it challenging to maintain focus due to her appealing demeanor.

Ratings.comment: Had her for hand-building ceramics and although I didn't care about ceramics she made it fun enough. And I went to class just to see her cause she's cool as hell and hot. Can you ask out a teacher after you're done with their class?
it's hard to focus in class when I am staring into her eyes longingly.

summary_comment: Professor Kennedy is highly regarded for his comprehensive knowledge and engaging teaching style, making his classes both challenging and enjoyable. Students appreciate his dedication and willingness to help, though some find the frequent student presentations repetitive. Overall, he is recommended for his unique perspective on photography and supportive classroom environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kennedy is highly regarded for his comprehensive knowledge and engaging teaching style, making his classes both challenging and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his willingness to help and his positive influence on their understanding of photography.

Ratings.comment: I have had Jaime for advanced photo and photo tech. He is awesome and I definitely recommend him. He also has a lot of knowledge behind his teaching.
I love Jamie Kennedy. He is very soft spoken and precious. His work is really awesome, but you have to ask him to see it. I agree that he is great with the ladies.

Jamie was challenging but fun. I loved the way he viewed the art world. You won't do well in his class if you don't try hard. But you will excel if you challenge yourself and spend tons of time on the projects. Mass amounts of time + quality work = an A.
Interesting class, for the most part. Very helpful and willing to stay after class to answer questions. The worst part was all the student presentations: after 3 or 4 out of 25, it got rather old.
Great sense of humor and quite the angelic voice.  Excellent with the ladies.
Cool guy. Very helpful. Take his class.

A good professor, has a great outlook on photography and makes the assingments are fun and interesting. Has an idealist approach. Very friendly. Would recommend this class for the GEC for Ohio State. It is a fun class.

summary_comment: Professor Doyle is highly regarded by many students for his engaging and humorous teaching style, and his genuine interest in both his students and their artwork. However, some find his class mandatory attendance policy burdensome and perceive it as dull, particularly due to its short duration and frequency. Overall, while there is a strong appreciation for his feedback and knowledge, the class structure and content can be challenging for those who struggle with consistent attendance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Doyle is highly regarded for his engaging and supportive teaching style, with students praising his knowledge, humor, and willingness to provide constructive feedback. However, his class requires strict attendance (5 points per 45-minute session, totaling 100 points), which can significantly impact the final grade, leading some to find it mandatory for passing.

Ratings.comment: The class is made up of 300 points. 100 midterm, 100 final, and 100 attendance. There are 2 classes a week (45 min) and you get 5 points for attending each class. You have to sign the attendance sheet and I would recommend staying b/c it is the ONLY way to pass. I got an A but the few sessions I signed in and left, I missed those points on the exam
if you enjoy taking an Intro To Art class taught by a man with a monotone and NO passion for art, take this class.  DREADED going every session.

Casey is a good professor, I just hated attending this class because it was boring. The subject matter was a lot more interesting than some classes but this was a 2 credit class and was only 48min twice a week, so I didn't feel like driving to OSU for it. Attendance is manditory (5 points per class, total of 100 points), so sign the sheet and stay.
Love, love, love Casey! Hes great about giving feedback and is so helpful in class. One of the most interesting teachers I've had at OSU so far!

I was interested in sculpture, until I took this class. Casey is a fun and interesting person. He is not very good at giving feedback before critiques, but will give you plenty of feedback AFTER grades are handed out. I asked plenty of questions and still feel like I learned little or nothing more about sculpture.
i love this man. he is such an excellent teacher. i miss him & his class now that it's over, LOL.

Casey is by far the best art teacher I've ever had. He's very helpful, fun to be around, and shows a genuine interest in you as a person and your artwork. If you are interested in taking an art class that he is teaching, TAKE IT! Rearrange your entire schedule if you have to! It will be worth it. :)

He is really fun, knowledgeable, and funny! He talks to you about your ideas before you start working a lot, which is very helpful. He is not afraid to be honest and puts forth a lot of positive criticism. Great teacher.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Clemens is known for his thorough coverage of material, which requires significant student diligence to fully grasp. However, his teaching methods and grading system are widely criticized, with many students finding his lectures and exams challenging and subjective. Some students appreciate his patience and willingness to help, while others describe his classes as confusing and poorly structured.
summary_comment_short: Professor Clemens is known for his thorough coverage of material, which requires significant student diligence to fully grasp, though his teaching methods are effective for dedicated students. However, several students describe him as a challenging and often unhelpful instructor, criticizing his ambiguous teaching style, subjective grading, and poor instructional clarity.

Ratings.comment: Dr.Clemens is very thorough in covering the material, and has reasonable expectations of his students. Anatomy is difficult because of the vast amount of material, so how much you learn depends a lot upon your own diligence. Dr Clemens can't make his students study, but for those who do, (even a little) his lectures and labs solidify your knowledge

Worst teacher, only teacher who makes you buy RIVES paper, uses obscure language to hide the fact that any opinion he gives can niether be right or wrong. Grading system is subjective, if you have no drawing skill I highly advise you to choose a different teacher. gives very poor instructions. Note:i did well in this class, this is not bitter reven
Incredibly helpful and patient. He made me feel comfortable with drawing, thought it was my first art class. I would definitely recommend him.
in a 3 hour class with him.. i would rather shoot myself in the foot.  wears brown every single day.
Worst professor experience yet.  He doesn't know how to teach, makes stuff up on the fly (ambiguos material), and grades based on a "check plus - check minus" system.

summary_comment: Professor Lucas has been criticized for poor teaching skills, leaving students feeling overwhelmed and unsupported, particularly in her digital manipulation course. Students recommend finding alternative resources or classes if possible.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lucas's teaching quality is widely considered poor, with students finding her explanations confusing and difficult to follow, even for those with prior knowledge. Students also frequently request that she slow down and focus more on flash-based content.

Ratings.comment: I took her digital manipulation course. Her teaching skills are poor. She slightly charismatic which is deceiving but she leaves you in the dust. I already knew photoshop before this class. I don't understand how anyone learned with her teaching the class. Find another teaching if you have to take it.
Can we please  have a flash only class?
needs to slow down

summary_comment: Professor Estep is highly regarded for his engaging and supportive teaching style, which makes classes enjoyable and accessible. Students appreciate his down-to-earth nature and his willingness to assist, as well as his inclusive classroom environment that allows the use of devices like iPods while creating art.
summary_comment_short: Professor Estep is highly regarded for his down-to-earth demeanor and willingness to assist students, making his classes engaging and enjoyable. Students appreciate his approachable nature and the inclusive classroom environment he fosters.

Ratings.comment: He is extreamly attractive which made it easy to get up and go to class! He is very down to earth and willing to help! ipods and such are welcome in his classroom while making art. Loved the class!
I loved this class.  Ryan is the best teacher ever.... and what a HOTTIE!! There aren't enough peppers to explain how hot he is! His plaid shirts make him look like a hot artist lumberjack.

summary_comment: Professor MacKay is known for his high-quality teaching, delivering clear and engaging lectures. However, students note that his classes can be quite warm due to his energetic teaching style.
summary_comment_short: Professor MacKay is known for his high-quality teaching, delivering clear and engaging lectures. However, students have noted that his classes can be quite warm due to the intensity of his teaching style.

Ratings.comment: Very hot!

summary_comment: Professor Peterson is known for his high-energy and passionate teaching style, which challenges students with intensive projects and a significant final assignment. Students consistently praise his willingness to help and his ability to make the class both enjoyable and rewarding, often considering it the highlight of their time at OSU.
summary_comment_short: Professor Peterson is known for his high-energy and passionate teaching style, which challenges students with intensive projects and a significant final assignment, yet makes the learning experience rewarding and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his approachability, enthusiasm for photography and art, and his dedication to helping students achieve their best work.

Ratings.comment: INSANE, 10 projects, 1 final that was 50% of your grade and in 10 weeks. I never have workd so hard. Good prof with high energy.
Good guy; interesting class, but I believe he left OSU.
Projects were hard, I spent 24hours on one. Overall Prof. Peterson kicks it up a notch, and is always willing to help, and rocked my world and everyone in my class.
Herb is a very passionate man and he inspires you to be passionate about image making!
If only all college classes could be this great. At first I was a bit scared at the work amount, but Herb made it all too enjoyable!

This was my favorite class at OSU. Herb is really interested in what he teaches and helping his students make great art projects, while not worrying so much about grades. He's very  approachable and keep the class interesting.
The best class I have ever taken at OSU. Professor Peterson made every class worth being at. Not your average GEC.
Great Teacher. Very excited about photography and art. I would definitely take another class with Herb. The class itself is challenging (not easy), but very rewarding.

I took Herb's Intro to Digital Photography class and had a blast. I at first thought I would learn a lot about my camera, but soon began to think more about art and how I am able to make art by using my camera. Herb was very nice and open to all forms of thinking. I would reccomend taking this class with him, you'll love it!

summary_comment: Professor Gose is known for his excellent sense of humor and engaging teaching style, which many students find enjoyable and memorable. However, he is also recognized for being an extremely strict grader and for pushing students to work independently and complete challenging projects within limited timeframes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gose is known for his excellent sense of humor and engaging teaching style, which many students find enjoyable and memorable. However, he is also recognized for being an extremely strict grader and setting high expectations that require significant additional work outside of class.

Ratings.comment: great sense of humor! I loved him
He is funny and easy-going about some things, but he has some inappropriate teaching policies.  Extremely difficult grader, and expects students to do more than they are capable of in the time given.

Chris was very helpful, yet at the same time pushed us to think for ourselves and solve our own problems.  Expect to put in a lot of work outside of class to complete your projects.  Critiques were very helpful.
coolest prof ever. fun, easy going, interesting, hilarious

summary_comment: Professor Sotosky is known for her rigorous approach to teaching, particularly in her Expanded Media class, where students find the content challenging but ultimately rewarding. While some appreciate the high standards and professional demeanor, others criticize her for being overly serious and unhelpful, especially in introductory courses, where she expects significant prior knowledge and relies heavily on external resources.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sotosky is known for her demanding approach, particularly in editing and video production, which challenges students to produce high-quality work but can be overwhelming. While some find her classes valuable, others criticize her for being overly serious and unhelpful, especially in introductory courses, where she expects a level of prior knowledge that may not be appropriate.

Ratings.comment: Stacey's Expanded Media class was very challenging, BUT in the end I was amazed by the video projects I was able to create. Editing takes alot of time. I liked the class alright, and would probably take it again.
Takes herself too seriously. Graded us like grad students.

Stacey was one of those professors that outside of the class would most likely be a really interesting person but in class she was unhelpful, expected far to much previous knowledge out of students in an intro class, and pushed all learning onto Lynda. Extremely unprofessional and unwilling to help.

summary_comment: Professor Mays is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, making complex topics in photography accessible and interesting. Students appreciate her approachability, humor, and ability to challenge them to think critically about art. Her comprehensive resources and supportive approach make her one of the standout professors at OSU.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mays is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, making even lengthy lectures feel dynamic and interesting. Students consistently praise her approachability, humor, and ability to challenge them while fostering a deep understanding of photography and art.

Ratings.comment: Fantastic lecturer. I loved coming to class everyday and was never bored. If you're interested in photography she makes sitting through long lectures very interesting. Her resources for tests were always really helpful and easy to study from.

A great professor. Very approachable and down to earth. If you have questions, she's always happy to help. She challenged me to think about and consider art in a way I hadn't thought of before. She was definitely my favorite professor this semester. And she's an interesting artist to boot!

Aspen has been my favorite professor here at OSU. She's passionate, talented, and full of knowledge. She's funny and very approachable when you need help. I would love to take another of her classes some time. She's THE BEST!!!

She's awesome!! Totally would take her again. She made looking at 100's of pic slides interesting- she is so funny, knowledgeable and passionate. She's what totally made the class- otherwise I prob would've always skipped. Her tests are easy if you read the technical readings. Most teachers give a review so you don't have to memorize tons of pics

she is very helpful with projects and creates interesting prompts, you just need to go talk to her individually for help or ideas. this class requires a lot of work, but if you stay on top of it and really talk with her then it's not hard at all.

summary_comment: Professor McDevitt is highly passionate about art and dedicated to helping students succeed, though his classes are intensive and challenging, especially for those without prior drawing experience. He effectively brings out the best in his students, ensuring significant improvement. Students recommend him as an inspiring and caring instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor McDevitt is highly passionate about art and dedicated to helping students succeed, though his classes can be demanding for those without prior drawing experience. He effectively brings out the best in his students, ensuring they make significant progress.

Ratings.comment: Very passionate about art and willing to push students to succeed. The class is time consuming and difficult if you have no drawing experience, but Michael is able to bring out any talents the students have to ensure that they come out far better than they started.
Very passionate about art and wants his students to succeed. Really enjoyed getting to know him as a person throughout the semester. Definitely recommend him as a teacher.

summary_comment: Professor Dawson is known for his detailed and sometimes lengthy explanations and assignments, which can be challenging to follow. He places significant emphasis on attendance and expects high standards from his students, making it difficult to please him. His lectures often involve extensive video presentations that students find hard to understand despite his thorough explanations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dawson is known for his meticulous approach to teaching, where he places significant emphasis on attendance and expects clear, precise work from students. His lectures and explanations, while thorough, can be lengthy and sometimes confusing, which challenges students to stay engaged and understand the material fully.

Ratings.comment: The projects themselves aren't hard; the hardest part is trying to please him. He cares a lot about attendance. He takes a long time explaining things or showing videos that still don't make sense at the end. He's wordy and kind of unclear in his assignments.

summary_comment: Professor Mallios is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, effectively communicating complex concepts and making the learning experience enjoyable and engaging. Students find her knowledgeable and inspiring, motivating them to pursue their interests in the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mallios is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, effectively communicating complex concepts and making the learning experience enjoyable. Students find his classes engaging and motivating.

Ratings.comment: Jessica is the best photography professor that I have had to date. She has a good knowledge base and is able to communicate clearly. She also makes class enjoyable and not a chore. She makes me want to learn!

summary_comment: Professor Ambron is highly regarded for his mellow, helpful, and supportive approach, effectively fostering artistic growth through unconventional drawing exercises and constructive, fair feedback. However, his consistency was variable; while he excelled early in the semester, he became frequently tardy later on, though he remained a great teacher when well-rested.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ambron is known for his mellow and supportive teaching style, which encourages artistic growth through unconventional drawing exercises and constructive, fair feedback. While some students found his help invaluable, others noted inconsistencies in his availability and punctuality, which affected the quality of his teaching at times.

Ratings.comment: Very mellow, helpful, and nice. There are always random set-ups to draw that seem strange, but he helps you grow as an artist. Always fair with grading and provides constructive feedback that isn't too harsh.
Michael was very helpful in the beginning of the year, but by the end he was always late. When he got enough sleep, he was a great teacher. Sadly that wasn't consistently him.

summary_comment: Professor Meighan is highly regarded for her exceptional advisory and teaching skills, consistently going above and beyond to support her students. She effectively guides them in choosing appropriate courses for their majors and provides valuable information about internships and other opportunities. Her approachable and friendly demeanor makes her both an effective teacher and advisor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Meighan is highly regarded for her dedication and support, consistently going above and beyond to assist students with their academic and career paths. Her advising and teaching style are praised for being helpful, informative, and approachable.

Ratings.comment: I have had her as an advisor and a teacher and she has always gone the extra mile to help me out. Not only did she guide me to taking the right classes for my major, but also internship and other opportunities.
Had her as an advisor too; totally willing to go the extra mile to help you.
i had her for ARTSCI 100 which is a survey class so its not hard at all but I also had her as an advisor. she is very helpful, informing, nice, and easy going.
No Comments
No Comments

The class was fun. If I was a freshman, sophmore, or a junior I might have changed my major. I loved Kami, but everyone in glass rocks, so if you can get in take it. If you are rejected show up the first day. It's worth your time to try.

summary_comment: Professor Fahy is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and deep knowledge in photography. Students consistently praise her for being extremely helpful, attentive, and knowledgeable, with many recommending her classes for anyone interested in the subject.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fahy is an exceptional teacher known for her expertise and helpfulness, with over 20 years of experience as a photographer. Students consistently recommend her classes, praising their quality and the instructor's attentiveness to students' needs.

Ratings.comment: She is an awesome teacher. She is extremely helpful and great at what she does.  I would highly recommend taking her class if you have any interest in photography at all.
Wonderful class. Very helpful and attentive to everyones needs. Fun class, definitely take this class
Amazing lady, definitely take her classes
Fantastic Digital Photography class, with a knowledgable prof. She has been a photographer for over 20 years, and she knows her stuff. Highly recommed.

summary_comment: Professor Betancourt is highly regarded for her engaging and dynamic teaching style, which balances lecture, discussion, and interactive activities like microwritings to keep classes lively and informative. Her dedication to her students is evident through her willingness to provide thorough feedback and additional support, making her an exceptional instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Betancourt is an exceptional instructor known for her engaging and dynamic teaching style, which includes a mix of discussions, lectures, and writing exercises that keep classes interesting and prevent boredom. She is highly dedicated to her students' success, offering thorough and supportive feedback and ensuring a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Veronica's class was very interesting and served as an excellent second writing class and also a nice art criticism introduction class. Group/class discussion with some lecture and microwritings were a typical class but it never got boring or repetitive. Veronica cared about our writing projects and would offer helpful feedback if asked. Recommend.

Nothing but positive things to say about Veronica. If you need ANYTHING she will help you. She is very fair in grading and her abilities and intelligence when it comes to the subject matter is obvious; you care because she cares. Exceptional instructor.
Great second writing class.Focus on class discussion and breaks up the class period with different teaching techniques. Very nice and easy-going.

summary_comment: Professor Smith is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality and willingness to assist students. Students find him approachable, knowledgeable, and supportive, particularly in providing feedback and helping with project ideas. His classes are strongly recommended for their comprehensive support and engaging content.
summary_comment_short: Professor Smith is highly regarded for his excellent teaching and willingness to assist students, making him an invaluable resource. Students consistently praise his knowledge, availability, and supportive approach in the classroom.

Ratings.comment: Tim is awesome! He is so nice and helpful and is always willing to listen to you if you need something or need to talk to him about something. He's a great TA, and another great perk is that he's pretty attractive.

LOVED Tim....I highly recommend his class. He is a reallly really cool guy and he knows what ehs talking about. He is always willing to help you with ideas for projects. He gives a lot of feedbak on the projects too which I loved. Definitely try to get him for Art 300.02!

summary_comment: Professor Woolson is widely regarded as an excellent teacher who genuinely cares about social issues, particularly opposing war. However, some students found his lectures overly focused on this topic, which detracted from practical instruction on photography. Additionally, there were concerns about biased grading and inappropriate behavior, such as flirting during class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Woolson is widely regarded as an excellent teacher who genuinely cares about his students and important social issues, though some find his focus on war and related topics excessive and detracts from practical instruction. However, others criticize his teaching methods, citing bias in grading and a lack of hands-on guidance in using cameras.

Ratings.comment: Ash is a great guy, an excellent teacher, and someone who truly cares about humanity. Thank god he talked about exactly how wrong war is. We should all be talking about it.

Would talk about anything but how to use a camera. He felt like it was our duty to learn it on our own. His grading on the assignment was very biased. If he doesn't like you then be ready to have low grades.

This guy is just super annoying and weird.  He used to rant just about  every class about the war and how wrong we were to be in it therefore he would take up about 30-45 minutes of class with his BS.  Therefore I learned nothing about how to properly operate a camera and take good professional pictures.  He was always flirting w/ this one girl too

summary_comment: Professor Baginski is often described as unhelpful and rude, with students feeling she treats them condescendingly and fails to organize the class effectively. Many find her expectations high and her communication style off-putting, though some acknowledge her knowledge in ceramics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Baginski is frequently described as unapproachable and unorganized, often coming across as rude and dismissive to students, particularly those who are not art majors. Students find her expectations high and her methods unhelpful, leading to confusion and frustration, especially regarding grading.

Ratings.comment: She is blatantly rude and treats everyone like children saying things like "No, it's not your turn to ask me questions right now". She seems to think that everyone is an art major and we have hours to devote to the class when it is a GEC for most. It's the end of the semester and I still don't know what my grade is. Unorganized to say the least.

For being an INTRO to ceramics class this woman sure expects a lot. She shoots down ideas until you do what she wants. She is very rude, sarcastic and not very helpful. We were assigned new assignments without even finishing other ones. She also treats her class like kindergartners.Class would have been 100X better if she wasn't the instructor.

Carolyn is an awesome professor! She is extremely helpful about everything. She's always willing to come in on the weekends to help with projects. It is apparent that she is very knowledgable in ceramics. Overall a fabulous professor.
Carolyn is very informative and helpful. She has a strange way of letting you know whether or not she likes your art and can come off as rude. Other than that she is a good professor. have fun

summary_comment: Professor Tursich offers an accessible class that requires engagement and creativity for success. The course consists of both lecture and lab components, with exams focusing on lecture material and regular projects. While the professor is described as approachable and supportive, she maintains professional boundaries, advising students to stay attentive and complete assignments diligently to perform well.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tursich offers an accessible class that requires engagement and creativity for success, particularly through regular assignments and projects. The class structure includes both lecture and lab components, with exams focusing on material covered in lectures, and overall, students find it manageable as long as they stay attentive and complete the work diligently.

Ratings.comment: The class was easy enough if you completed assignments with at least some degree of creativity.

This class is easy as long as you pay attention. There's a lab and a lecture portion. Exams are based on info from the lectures, and there are projects every couple of weeks. Crystal is nice, but doesn't try to be your friend. Try and you'll do fine in this class.

summary_comment: Professor Bearse is known for his vague communication and lack of clear expectations, leading to frustration among students. He does not provide grades until the end of the semester and has been described as inconsistent in his approach, sometimes appearing supportive but other times unengaged. Students find his teaching style challenging and generally do not recommend it.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bearse is known for his vague communication and lack of immediate feedback, leading to confusion among students regarding expectations and project directions. Students also report feeling unsupported and unengaged during class, with some noting that he rarely provides grades, making it difficult to gauge performance.

Ratings.comment: He doesn't give back any grades until the end of the semester  and is the most vague professor I have ever encountered. He is completely unable to relay his expectations of the students and gets frustrated over misunderstandings. Would not recommend. Ever.

Tim gives projects a week before they were due (including our final project)  and gives vague directions. He seems to also go from being very supportive and helpful one minute to not caring about you, which leaves you confused. Tim also never hands back grades.

Tim do not care if you are there or not, which means you will be really free to come and leave. Only thing is that you must prepare for each project, because there only few projects, each of them are important. It is not so easy to get a A grade from his critic.

summary_comment: Professor Merchant is known for his kindness and passion for art, but his teaching style can be less critical, potentially making it difficult for students to gauge their performance accurately. Despite this, he expects high effort and quality in portfolios, ensuring thorough engagement. His classes can feel somewhat repetitive, with similar assignments for homework.
summary_comment_short: Professor Merchant is known for his dedication to art but is sometimes criticized for not providing enough critical feedback, which can make it challenging to gauge one's progress. Despite this, students appreciate his rigorous grading and the high standards he sets, emphasizing the importance of putting in full effort regardless of natural talent.

Ratings.comment: Sean is a very kind teacher who cares a lot about art, but he does not criticize your work a lot, so he can misleading on if you are doing a good job. He grades your portfolios tough so you need to give all of your effort even if you're not artistic. Class tends to be repetitive, and you do the same exact things for homework as well.

summary_comment: Professor Wetzel is highly regarded for her passion and care for her students, pushing them to excel while providing ample support and encouragement. Her teaching style is laid-back yet thorough, with a strong emphasis on personal growth and artistic development. While some students find her traditional methods and lack of project feedback limiting, her overall approach is praised for fostering a supportive and enriching learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wetzel is highly regarded for her dedication and care towards her students, pushing them to excel and providing ample support and inspiration. Her teaching style is appreciated for being laid-back yet demanding, focusing on personal growth and creativity, though some find her traditional methods and limited project feedback less engaging.

Ratings.comment: Heather was a wonderful professor who was very educated in her field. However, the photo lectures were VERY dry. She is a bit more old-fashioned in her techniques and doesn't give much feedback on projects which is frustrating. She seems "too busy" for the class. However, it is not difficult to pass and I feel like I learned how to photograph.

HEATHER IS THE BEST PROF EVER. I've been in her class several semesters in a row now and she's honestly the best instructor I've had by far. She really, genuinely cares about her students and pushes you to be the best artist you can be. She constantly provides support and inspiration for projects. Love u Heather xoxoxoxo

I really liked Heather and the class, She's very nice and laid back, really analyzes every students work and believes in every student. She has a great artistic ability, however seems uninterested in some of the "book" material of the class. its very easy to get an A, creative + artistic students will easily excel. I learned a lot about my camera!

Heather is one of the best, if not the best, instructor I've had at Ohio State. She has a tremendous amount of belief in her students to do great things and make great art. She has high expectations, but not outrageous. She made me feel so cared for as a student and artist. She makes you work for an A, but offers TONS of extra credit.

She's awesome. Very helpful. Hears out Every student, answers every question. She doesn't hand out A's on homework when she knows you can do better, but easy A with effort. She wants everyone to talk when doing critiques. But she's so chill & nice. She will help with your ideas for projects. Not huge deal if u 4get something, can bring it next time

summary_comment: Professor Lewis offers a Generative Education Course (GEC) that, while requiring a significant investment in art supplies, is highly engaging and enjoyable. Despite the substantial effort required for the homework, students find the class valuable, particularly for those genuinely interested in art. The professor's enthusiasm and approachability contribute significantly to the overall positive learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lewis offers a Generals Education Course (GEC) that requires a significant investment in art supplies rather than a textbook. While the homework is demanding, students find the class enjoyable due to Professor Lewis's engaging personality.

Ratings.comment: No textbook needed, but had to buy a good amount of art supplies. A GEC you should only take if you're interested in art. So much effort needed for the homework in this class, but the teacher was fun to talk to.

summary_comment: Professor Foley emphasizes effort and original ideas over technical skill, providing clear feedback when students seek it. His classes are demanding, with mandatory attendance and a focus on both work and play, though he encourages students to improve and introduces them to new artists. Grading can be uncertain until final grades are posted, and his rubric is sometimes seen as unclear.
summary_comment_short: Professor Foley is known for his clear expectations and consistent encouragement to improve, though his grading system is largely finalized until the end of the semester, which can be surprising for students. He values effort and original ideas over innate skill, and while he provides helpful feedback, his grading rubric is sometimes seen as unclear.

Ratings.comment: Sean seems cool and whatnot, but never grades you until the finals so don't be surprised, he almost never gives A's.Also  there is no way to know what your grade is until it is posted on your grades after the finals
No Comments

Sean's not concerned with how skilled you are, just if you put in effort and have good ideas. He's really helpful and gives good feedback if you ask for it. Attendance is mandatory, but it's the art department's requirement, not Sean's. He doesn't really care if you miss class occasionally. I took two of his classes I liked him so much. Very cool.

Sean consistently encouraged the whole class to work harder and he introduced us to new artists. Attendance  and participation = very important. The theme: to recognize and work with the relationship between work and play. He ended the class early and his grading rubric was unclear imo.

summary_comment: Professor Ritter is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, effectively imparting his artistic expertise and inspiring students to excel.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ritter is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, effectively inspiring and guiding students to excel in their artistic pursuits through dedicated instruction and hard work.

Ratings.comment: Amy is an outstanding artist, and she works very hard to teach others to be like her.

summary_comment: Professor Whitacre is known for his high-quality teaching, creating a fun and relaxed learning environment despite mandatory attendance primarily for completing work. Students appreciate his approach, understanding that while attendance is required for assignments, the overall atmosphere is supportive and enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Whitacre is known for his engaging and relaxed teaching style, though he emphasizes that attendance is crucial as it's the primary means of receiving assignments. Students appreciate his approachability and the supportive learning environment he fosters.

Ratings.comment: attendance is mandatory only because it the only way you get work done. you also WILL have to come in on your free time but its a really fun and relaxed environment. Brandon is a really great teacher!!

summary_comment: Professor Roberts is perceived as having mixed teaching qualities; while some students found him helpful and structured, others strongly disliked his approach, citing issues with his tardiness, lack of clarity in the course content, and inconsistent grading practices.
summary_comment_short: Professor Roberts is perceived as having mixed teaching qualities; while some students found his classes well-structured and helpful, others strongly disliked him, citing issues with his tardiness, lack of clarity regarding the course content, and perceived unfair grading practices.

Ratings.comment: Charlie was a good guy and really wanted to help everyone. I think he ran a good, structured class.

Hate him.  First of all, I thought we'd be doing storyboarding in this class, and we didn't do any of that, so that sucked.  Second, I hate Charlie Roberts.  He's a real jack ass.  He's lazy.  He was late a lot.  Sometimes he took points off on my projects, and when I asked him about it, he seemed like he was making up reasons on the spot. HATE HIM

summary_comment: Professor Baer is highly regarded for her supportive and encouraging teaching style, which fosters creativity and pushes students to exceed their current limits. However, her feedback can be somewhat generalized, and some students find her expectations and challenges to be unevenly balanced between foundational skills and experimental techniques.
summary_comment_short: Professor Baer excels at encouraging student effort and creativity, making class engaging and supportive. However, her feedback can be generalized and less technically detailed, which some students find limiting despite her clear enthusiasm for life drawing.

Ratings.comment: Really encourages students who show effort or novel techniques. She lets you make your work or style be completely your own. She will encourage students to go beyond their current boundaries. Made class exciting to go to.

Instructor Baer is really into life drawing, her enthusiasm is contagious! Her weakness is that she does not communicate clearly. She offers really generalized feedback, her suggestion for improvement in her class is "don't be generic". I appreciate that she is challenging students, but she needs to offer more complete and technical feedback.
I enjoyed Ginnie as a teacher, but I felt that the class could have been more challenging and technically based. I feel like you should know the basics before risking experimentation.

Art 370 is Beginning Life Drawing and professor Baer is so into drawing. She made the class fun and interesting and gave personal attention to anyone who needed it. On the flip side, she may assume the students know more than they really do ablut the subject. I worked hard in this class, and my grades reflected my lack of drawing ability.

summary_comment: Professor Barber is an engaging instructor who fosters a fun and creative learning environment. Students find his classes enjoyable and productive, encouraging them to bring their creativity to every session. Overall, he is highly regarded for his ability to make complex topics accessible and entertaining.
summary_comment_short: Professor Barber is an engaging instructor who fosters a fun and creative learning environment, significantly enhancing students' enjoyment and educational experience. His teaching style effectively encourages active participation and creativity, leading to meaningful learning outcomes.

Ratings.comment: Fun class. Nice instructor. Had fun in his class. Just come to class with your creativity cap on and you'll learn a lot.

summary_comment: Professor Lombardi's teaching style is inconsistent, ranging from overly simplistic demonstrations that some find tedious to a more relaxed, friendly approach that others appreciate. Her classroom management is uneven, sometimes treating students like children and showing favoritism, while at other times providing a supportive environment where she acts more as a friend than a traditional instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lombardi's teaching style is perceived as overly simplistic and repetitive, with frequent, lengthy demonstrations that some find tedious and unnecessary. Her classroom dynamics lean more towards a personal connection, which while appreciated by some, has led others to feel undervalued and confused by vague instructions.

Ratings.comment: Coming to class was the worst part of my day. She treated us like 3 year olds and did 3975 demos that were 2 hours long about 'how to glue 2 pieces of paper together'. she picked favorites. on the first day she'll ask you why you r taking the class and you can't say bc it was a requirement or she'll get mad. She wore ugly skirts.
Fun class, but expect vague directions. Often found many students confused by her instructions with little clarification. She's really cool though. Treated her more like a friend than a teacher.

summary_comment: Professor Hunter-Lombardi's class is characterized by its demanding yet enjoyable nature; while students find the projects time-consuming and sometimes frustrating due to specific and unclear assignments, they also appreciate her helpfulness and friendly approach. However, some students criticize the lectures as boring and the work as generally useless, suggesting a significant divide in how the class is perceived.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hunter-Lombardi's class is known for being very time-consuming, yet enjoyable overall, with students praising her helpfulness and friendly approach. However, some find her lectures dull and the work generally unengaging despite the high volume of assignments.

Ratings.comment: The projects were very time consuming. Overall a fun class, she's very helpful and treats you like more of a friend
This class should be renamed Scrap Paper 101. Her lectures were truly awful and mind-numbingly boring. The work was not hard, but it was time-consuming and generally useless.

Fun class, but there is A LOT to do. i often found myself frustrated with the inability to be completely creative, as many of the assignments are very specific, and sometimes, unclear until the very end. Still a blast, and fairly laid back.

summary_comment: Professor Fox is an excellent teacher known for her engaging personality and deep expertise in art and design. She maintains a supportive classroom environment where students feel encouraged to ask questions without fear of judgment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fox is an engaging and knowledgeable instructor who fosters a supportive learning environment. Students appreciate her expertise in art and design combined with her ability to encourage and empower students without making them feel inadequate.

Ratings.comment: Clare is a very cool teacher. She never answers a question, even if very basic, in a way that makes a student feel stupid. She has lots of personality which makes her classes lots of fun.
Knows art/design really well. Easy to get along with.

summary_comment: Professor Keida is known for his engaging and unconventional teaching style, which focuses on both technical skills and creative expression. While some students find his class challenging and entertaining, others appreciate his approachability, flexibility, and enthusiasm for photography. Overall, his classes are highly recommended for those seeking a fun and dynamic learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Keida is known for his engaging and unconventional teaching style, which focuses on creativity and fun over strict technical instruction. Students appreciate his approachability and flexibility, though some find the class content less focused on traditional photography skills.

Ratings.comment: A decent teacher. Covers the technical basics for exam purposes, but other than that projects and critiques are virtually a free-for-all. Most of his artistic focus in class is on things for entertainment and nothing that pertains to the class content whatsoever. take it as you will, it's the hardest-easiest class i've taken.

He is awesome! His class was way too different from any other class that I have ever taken. He teaches differently, shows lot of videos and we had lot of fun discussing ideas. Very approachable and flexible with deadlines. Highly recommend if someone is looking to take a fun filled photography class. Good human being.

Matt is really interested in teaching his students about more than just photography. He helps you with ideas and gets really excited when you put in a lot of effort, and when we have intense class discussions about projects. I would definitely suggest that everyone takes his class! And he makes a delicious baked ziti for the review sessions!!

I loved this class and Matt! He taught us without it seeming like a class. He was generally interested in making amazing photography. He wanted everyone to understand how to work the camera, but was more interested in helping people be creative. I loved it. His alter-ego is Matt Mascaro..
