summary_comment: Professor Thomas is highly regarded for her dedicated and engaging approach, genuinely valuing each student's input and diverse learning styles. While her course demands significant time outside of class, she ensures a rigorous and rewarding educational experience. The initial investment for supplies, including the textbook, is substantial but manageable, with the book available affordably online.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thomas is highly regarded for her dedicated approach to teaching, genuinely investing in each student's learning experience and valuing diverse perspectives. Her course demands significant time and resources outside of class, particularly with initial supplies costing around $150-$200, though she recommends purchasing the textbook from Amazon to keep costs down.

Ratings.comment: Danielle is genuinely interested in each student in the class. She appreciates everyones different styles and values your opinion. This is definitely not an easy A, and requires A LOT of time spent outside class. Also, supplies needed to get started can cost about $150-$200. Buy the book off amazon (you do use it) and it will be no more than $10.

summary_comment: No comments available
summary_comment_short: No comments available

summary_comment: Professor Scheuer is perceived as having poor preparation for classes and a focus on personal artistic endeavors rather than instruction. Students find his expectations for assignments unclear and feel overly criticized during critiques. His lectures are seen as lengthy and often unhelpful, leading many to advise against enrolling in his class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Scheuer is perceived as inadequate in class preparation and unresponsive to student inquiries, focusing more on his personal artistic work. Students find his class lacking in clarity regarding assignment expectations and overly critical, leading many to advise against enrolling.

Ratings.comment: I dont think he prepare classes well, instead, he focuses on his own artistic creation. I sent him emails to ask some questions but he never replied. In this class, except learning some basic knowledge, you can also learn communication skills! Because there are so many workshop or critique! Choose some other experienced professors.

If you are signed up for his class, drop. His expectations for assignments are NEVER clear, and he is a photographer himself so he expects way too much out of us. I would almost have a panic attack before presenting my projects because I knew he was going to criticize everything. He also will just spend 3 hours lecturing about useless stuff.

summary_comment: Professor Gluibizzi is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate lectures, which students find both entertaining and enlightening. Her teaching approach emphasizes participation and critical thinking, with a mix of exams and essays. However, some students have noted that the exams can be challenging and may include material not fully covered in class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gluibizzi is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate lectures, which are described as phenomenal and fun. However, her exams are noted to be very subjective, and some students found them challenging due to unexpected content.

Ratings.comment: Here's her class: 25 points for participation, 25 points for the midterm, 25 points for the final, and 25 points for an essay you make about an art exhibit. There are two opportunities for 3 points of extra credit. Her lectures are phenomenal, she is so intelligent and passionate it makes it fun to listen to. The tests are very subjective though.
Amanda is really passionate about contemporary art, and makes the class fun to attend.

The absolute best professor I've ever had. I wasn't interested in the topic going into the class (postmodernism isn't usually my jam) but she made me love it! She is hilarious and knows so much and I did not want the lectures to end. I was so sad when this class ended. She is the coolest. You won't even want to skip class.

Greatest professor ever. She is very passionate and inspirational about Contemporary Art. Lectures are super fun and help me understand and love Contemporary Art. She is very humorous as well. If you come to lectures and listen you will ace the tests. Only one paper is needed. Great class.

Horrible professor, put stuff on the exam that she didnt even go over or was not in the readinfs, ruins the appeal of being an art minor, tells you that the exam is much easier than the review and the exam turns out to be harder.

summary_comment: Professor Rucker, known as Ethan, is an engaging and supportive teacher who creates a welcoming classroom atmosphere with humor and creative input. He balances fun with academic rigor, encouraging participation and providing personalized feedback to help students improve. His approachable demeanor and understanding of students' needs contribute to a positive learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rucker is an engaging and humorous instructor who creates a lively classroom atmosphere with music and interactive discussions. He provides helpful feedback and makes the class both enjoyable and accessible, though students note that consistent attendance and effort are necessary for success.

Ratings.comment: A great teacher. I am older and took this class as part of the OSU 60+ program. Ethan made the class environment great through music and conversation; he's funny and also a painter himself so he always had good advice and answered questions helpfully. You have to attend and put some effort in but will do well if you try and it was very enjoyable

Ethan is a sold professor, he is young and understands where his students are coming from. Class is pretty smooth, he doesn't make you do excessive drawing as in other classes. He is a pretty funny dude and tries to make the whole class participate. When you are drawing he will give personal feedback on what to improve.

summary_comment: Professor Sharp is highly regarded as one of the best instructors at OSU, particularly in the field of photography. He effectively meets students where they are, fostering artistic growth and genuine academic success. His dedication to helping students excel, even those not majoring in art, is evident in his teaching approach.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sharp is highly regarded for his dedication to student growth and artistic development, genuinely supporting each student's unique journey in photography. His teaching approach effectively meets students where they are, making him one of the top instructors at OSU.

Ratings.comment: Photography is definitely a GE that requires a lot of work outside of class, so be ready for that. But Cameron is hands down one of the best instructors that I've had at OSU. He genuinely wants his students to excel & grow artistically, and he did a great job at meeting students where they were at, rather than wishing everyone were an art major

summary_comment: Professor Hamilton is highly regarded for her extensive knowledge and ability to guide students in asking the right questions, making her a valuable resource in the field of art. However, some students express disappointment, noting that she may be more focused on her own interests and less on providing consistent, positive mentorship, which has led to mixed perceptions of her character and teaching approach.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hamilton is highly regarded for her extensive knowledge and ability to guide students in critical thinking, though her teaching style may not suit those seeking direct instruction. However, some students have expressed disappointment, perceiving her as insincere and manipulative, which contrasts with her public image.

Ratings.comment: Ann is a great human being and an amazing source of knowledge. If you are looking for someone to tell you exactly what to do with your art, Ann is not that person. She will however, always guide you towards asking the right questions.

As a grad student, I would have expected more from Ann, who is suppose to be an art star. She is, as you would say, a fawner to get what she wants. Mostly nice to your face and vicious behind your back.
could it be more about her?
not what I expected

summary_comment: Professor Coffman is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, with students finding her lectures excessively long and boring, often lasting over three hours with minimal interaction or engagement. The class focuses heavily on projects for grading, which many find unengaging. While some acknowledge that she is a nice person, the overall consensus is that the class is a waste of time due to its format and length.
summary_comment_short: Professor Coffman is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, with students finding her lectures excessively long and boring, often lasting close to four hours. The class focuses heavily on projects rather than lecture content, and many students advise against taking her class, citing it as a waste of time and an ineffective use of their academic resources.

Ratings.comment: Worst professor Ive ever had. Made me hate photography. Highly recommend NOT taking this class. Save yourself and dont take photography in the hope you dont get her as your professor. Lecture was 3 hours long twice a week and absolutely boring. A waste of time as the class is graded on projects mostly. Dont email her and expect to get a reply.

Lectures are almost 3 hours long. Mine was 3:55-6:40. Its PowerPoint slide lectured with the lights off, you will want to sleep. Your main grades are projects. Shes a nice enough teacher but the class is boring as hell and way too long

summary_comment: Professor Jarrells is known for his high standards and emphasis on attendance, requiring students to attend all classes and critiques. While some find his class challenging and appreciate his encouragement to explore personal ideas, others criticize him for being unorganized, inexperienced, and overly strict, particularly regarding attendance and grading.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jarrell is known for his high expectations and strict attendance policy, which some find challenging but others appreciate for fostering a serious and focused learning environment. He is described as encouraging and open to exploring new ideas, though some students have noted issues with organization and perceived bias.

Ratings.comment: Harder than I thought it would be. He was nice and gave good feedback. You cant miss class and need to show up for critiques. he also doesn't like phones.
Not the most organized but really nice and a pretty fun class.

Travis is great! He really encourages people to experiment. We spent the beginning of the semester learning drawing techniques with different materials and then the later part we started making our own work with open ended prompts. I think the people who complain were just didn't do the work. If you put in effort you will get an A.

Not sure why this teacher is getting such bad reviews. He does require attendance but he also is really open and willing to work with students. He really pushes for you to explore your own ideas and challenges what you think art is. He also grades really easy if you actually do the work.
Capital NO! Did not like it
Will not recommend. He is Inexperienced, Bias and is a tough grader
Not experienced
Very strict on attendance

summary_comment: Professor Helms is highly regarded for her knowledge and friendliness, though some students note the course demands significant extra time outside of class. She emphasizes the importance of effort and dedication, offering multiple opportunities for extra credit. However, the course can be demanding, particularly for those with a heavy workload.
summary_comment_short: Professor Helms is highly regarded for her knowledge and friendliness, though some students find the course demanding, requiring significant extra time outside of regular class hours. She is described as an easy grader who emphasizes effort and attendance, providing multiple opportunities for extra credit.

Ratings.comment: She was pretty cool. Sometimes I wish she was a tad more available in the ceramics building, but she was pretty available for being pregnant and she knows her stuff.
Work hard. Put effort into your work and be a genuine person and you will succeed in this course.

Great Professor. Super friendly and easy to get along with. Just like any other art class though, very time consuming. I took it as a general elective, and ended up working on this class outside of regular hours more than my major courses. Easy grader. As long as you put in effort and show up, you'll get a good grade. Multiple chances for EC.

This was a high fire ceramics class. Helms made you come in and do a ridiculous amount of extra work outside of class time. If you are taking a full course load that requires you to do a lot of work, don't take this course. You need to have a lot of free time to do the projects.

summary_comment: Professor Larsen is highly regarded for his teaching quality, consistently praised for being helpful and understanding. While his assignments maintain a structured approach, they effectively challenge students to explore various mediums and styles. Although some lectures may be initially confusing, Professor Larsen provides clear, one-on-one explanations that enhance comprehension.
summary_comment_short: Professor Larsen is highly regarded for his teaching quality, known for being supportive and understanding. He challenges students to explore various mediums and styles, pushing them beyond their comfort zones while occasionally facing some confusion in lectures, which he addresses effectively through one-on-one sessions.

Ratings.comment: Absolutely loved this class. Nick was always really helpful and understanding. Even though the assignments are pretty structured each one still challenged me to use different mediums and styles from my normal medium/style of drawing. Some of the lectures were confusing but he explained the ideas one on one in a way that made sense. So encouraging!

summary_comment: Professor Masello is an outstanding teacher who effectively balances challenge with support, particularly in introductory courses. He fosters a positive learning environment where mistakes are seen as opportunities for growth, and his overall teaching quality is highly regarded.
summary_comment_short: Professor Masello is an outstanding teacher who effectively balances challenge with support, particularly in introductory courses. He fosters a positive learning environment where mistakes are seen as opportunities for growth, making him both a rigorous and approachable instructor.

Ratings.comment: John challenges his students but was great at teaching an intro level class because he understood that there would be mistakes and it wasn't the end of the world. Overall, just an awesome person and a great teacher.

summary_comment: Professor Battersby is highly regarded for his dedication and care towards his students and his subject matter. Despite occasional humorous mishaps, such as canceling a class due to an injury, he maintains a strong reputation for excellence in teaching. His passion for art is evident and deeply appreciated by his students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Battersby is highly regarded for his dedication and care towards his students and subject matter, though some students have noted his occasional absences due to personal health issues. Despite these lapses, he is widely recommended for both his teaching and his character.

Ratings.comment: Jamie is a complete trip, he cancelled class once because he broke his ribs falling off of the side of a couch. 10/10 would recommend as a professor and as a human. He really cares about his students and his art.
